Blog.post: I didn't realize this would be an event worth written down, until I find my eyes turn watery everytime I tell people what I did for you this week....... I still remember those days and nights we shared together. Drinks we had, jokes we made, groceries we bought, food we enjoyed, laughters, tears, everything and everything. I can't express how much I love you guys, and how much I cherish the friendship between us. It's been more than two months since I left Toronto, but I still miss you guys so much so much. People find it unbelievable that I cried because of leaving you guys. Parting has been making me depressed since March. I cried during the standing ovation for His Holyness the Dalai Lama. My tears started to drop when I thought of the days living without you. So sad, so so so sad. Everytime when I tell my friends how lucky I've been in the past four years, I can hardly hide my happiness and honour. The image of Andrea telling me Spencer's comment, "she's come a long way in the four years," keeps flashing in my mind. Indeed, a long, but memorable and enjoyable way to become today's Evie. A couple of weeks ago I talked to Andrea on the phone. She told me there's an Asian grocery store opened up in her neighbourhood, and how she wanted to go inside. Spencer said she would be even more depressed if she sees all the stuff that relates to me, so she didn't end up go in. That reminded me how much you guys enjoy my Asian candies, so I decided to send you a love package, just like the one you gave me two years ago. You gave me a package for me to bring on my 3-day greyhound trip. There were game bookIs to prevent me from boredom, dental set, sanitizer, a pack of listerine breath-freshing strips, a note pad for me to write down whatever thoughts I have during my trip, candies and snacks, and a disposable camera. Maybe there were something else, I forgot. I received the bag of goodies on the day of my departure. I just finished the last shower before my roadtrip, and reluctantly prepared to leave for downtown to get on the bus. It was totally a surprise, but it did cheer me up!! ^_^" I wanted to put together a package of all Andrea's favourite--since she's the one who's leaving. Coffee rolls, veggie crackers, glico curry (10X spicy), orange chocolate pocky sticks, clear noodle, apple chew, udon noodles, koala chocolate cookies, and a cup of Taiwanese Mr. Noodle were what I ended up buying. I've also included something for Janine and Erin. I hope this package will make her miss me a bit less while she's away in Australia for the next year. No matter how far we are apart, I know we'll always have one another deeply in our hearts. I miss you, girls....
